channel.title: mangOH Red vs. 'X' Operator SIM
channel.description:
Hi guys,
We've purchased a brand new mangOH red with WP7702, so we're still in the "struggling phase". We're trying to connect it to the AirVantage platform using a SIM that's not the one included in the kit (and it's not from Sierra Wireless, it's from a local MNO). The problem is that the ICCID doesn't get recognized by AirVantage, which would make sense if a Sierra Wireless SIM was mandatory for this. However, we didn't find this in the "getting started" guide.
So, the question is: do we have to use a Sierra Wireless SIM card for AirVantage? Sorry if this is a noob question!
Thanks in advance!
Regards, GM

item.title: mangOH Red vs. 'X' Operator SIM
item.dc:creator: gmilano
item.description:
OK, I could finally try this out. Sorry it took me so long to come back to you on this, @jdots83 . I’ve been quite busy the last few days and didn’t get the time to do it.

This is definitely the RIGHT answer, not sure if this should be the final solution. We had some issues regarding AV usage, specifically with the “administrative” part. As @jdots83 stated, you need another user and a “new” company in order to use this solution. Keep in mind, this requires another “company” email address. Also, you need to remove the mangOH board from the current AV account, which seems obvious. Sadly, both this tasks are easier said than done, at least from the AV web GUI.

AV user and mangOH device removal, is not straightforward. This is actually why we had to get in touch with SiWi in the first place. Up to this moment, we couldn’t delete all our users from the current company, so we needed SiWi to do this for us. In order to “delete” the mangOH device, you have to remove the information from the mangOH paired with the Sierra SIM card in AV, i.e. remove all info in “Gateway” and click on “Save”:

After this, you can create the mangOH device in the new AV account. This seems like an unnecessary workaround for a task that SHOULD be easy. Perhaps there’s an easier way to do this… We’ve been talking to the SiWi guys (thanks D. Lahay for all the assistance!) and they’re currently working hard on getting a “seamless experience” using mangOH with AV.

Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: mangOH Red vs. 'X' Operator SIM
item.dc:creator: gmilano
item.description:
OK, this looks promising indeed. Will try it out and let you know how that goes.

Nice job, @jdots83!

Read full topic

item.title: mangOH Red vs. 'X' Operator SIM
item.dc:creator: awneil
item.description:
When I said,

awneil:

AirVantage does not cope well with changing the SIM in a device

The problem was not that it didn’t work - comms were fine - but that AV didn’t notice, and didn’t seem to have any way to be told, that the SIM had changed.

I guess the place to go for specific AirVantage (rather than mangOH) discussions would be:

https://forum.sierrawireless.com/c/cloud-management-services

There were a number of things mentioned at the Innovation Summit in Paris this year that would rely specifically on having a SiWi SIM…

Read full topic

item.title: mangOH Red vs. 'X' Operator SIM
item.dc:creator: jdots83
item.description:
I was able to connect using a Hologram SIM purpose-built for iot. The trick is to go in through https://eu.airvantage.net/accounts/signup?type=AVEP rather than the one I had used to register a MangOH with a SiWi SIM, which is https://eu.airvantage.net/session/login. I had to create a new, separate account with AirVantage (different company name, different email), respond to the confirmation email in order to create a password, etc. Finally in, via https://eu.airvantage.net/start I then see a new tab called Register. Choosing hardware of MangOH, I see the three questions (Serial Number, IMEI, Hardware name) (Enter FSN for the Serial Number). A choice is offered to “pre-configure” and I chose Yes, then in the follow-on question I only enabled it to “Set Heartbeat”. (Other options may be ok as well). The difference between this and the mangOH/SiWi SIM registration is that there is nowhere to enter a SIM ICCID, and that’s Ok. Then it was a matter of setting the APN on the Red (as described in the Getting Started Guide). AirVantage took some time doing steps “Configure Communication” and “Synchronize System”. After those were completed, I started the app redSensorToCloud and saw successful data transfers.

My support guy from Richardson (distributor) was very helpful and patient. According to him, if I want to swap out this Hologram SIM for a different Non-SiWi one, I should only have to change the APN, and no need to make changes to the AirVantage side. I will let you know how that goes.

Kudos to Sierra Wireless and the mangOH team for making this an unbundled system, so that we can be free to choose the provider that works best for us in our specific case.

That said, the support guy did make reference to some advantages to using the SiWi SIM, such as the ability to make changes on the fly and in one place after a lot of things have been deployed. I would like to learn more about that and other advantages to choosing Sierra Wireless as our access provider.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: jdots83
item.description:
I have been trying a similar approach and getting exactly the same result “Subscription cannot be found”. Thanks @gmilano and @awneil for your efforts. I was trying to use a SIM from Hologram and can’t make it work. I can understand SiWi can’t support every SIM maker. I have a SIM from AT&T coming in the mail in a few days. I’ll try that and report back to you.

item.title: mangOH Red vs. 'X' Operator SIM
item.dc:creator: awneil
item.description:
As noted, it was about a year ago that I tried this.

My notes from then do, indeed, refer to using ‘Inventory’ on AV - and I also can’t see that when I log in now.

Read full topic

item.title: mangOH Red vs. 'X' Operator SIM
item.dc:creator: gmilano
item.description:
So, the first link you posted relates to an “Inventory” activity, which doesn’t appear in the pre-configured SiWi account for mangOH. It took me a while, but I found this which clearly shows where the “Inventory” option is in the menu bar (on the left of “Monitor”). You can check in the screenshot I’ve uploaded that this option isn’t available.

I’m still trying the option in the second link you posted, but it doesn’t look good so far.

Anyway, I think I’m done trying to link the local MNO’s SIM to AirVantage. I’d probably go for other options.

Thanks for the help!

Read full topic

Thanks, @awneil. I’ll try this out and let you know.

Read full topic

item.title: mangOH Red vs. 'X' Operator SIM
item.dc:creator: awneil
item.description:
I guess that AirVantage “knows” the SiWi SIMs in advance - but not 3rd party SIMs.

So you have “register” the SIM first.

Does this help: https://doc.airvantage.net/av/reference/inventory/howtos/activateOrSynchronizeSubscription/

ISTR that AirVantage does not cope well with changing the SIM in a device …

EDIT

or maybe this: https://source.sierrawireless.com/airvantage/av/howto/hardware/airlink_getting_started/ ?

Read full topic
